author: joeyaiello
body: There are still some error messages and warnings being emitted by PowerShell Core that refer to "Windows PowerShell". We should scrub through [all strings in the repository](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/search?utf8=%E2%9C%93&q=%22windows+powershell%22) and change these to "PowerShell" where applicable (i.e. for everything that isn't FullCLR-specific).

comments.author: zackschuster
comments.body: If a file contains a reference to things like `<windows.h>`, `System.Windows.Forms` or .NET Framework 4.5, does that invalidate it for conversion? Going through the code, it seems like all instances of "Windows PowerShell" are either directly or indirectly connected to those resources, which makes me wary of submitting a PR with any conversions.

comments.author: SteveL-MSFT
comments.body: @zackschuster That's a good point.  Currently, the Windows PowerShell (fullclr) code is intermixed with the PSCore code.  Let's defer this for now.

comments.author: iSazonov
comments.body:
Currently we only have 'Windows PowerShell' in some Resx files related to workflows and remoting.
Also we have 'Windows PowerShell' strings in comments in *.cs files.

Should we keep the Issue open?

comments.author: SteveL-MSFT
comments.body: I think the intent of this was more for user facing strings, so I think we can resolve this as fixed.

title: Scrub for 'Windows PowerShell' in strings
